Stefan Tilkov wrote:

> I agree on all the fundamentals of RESTful design. I'm opposed to 
> cookies in general. But, *if* I want to track unauthenticated users, 
> cookies seem like a good option since I can decide to have everything 
> identifiable by a URI and use them as a purely optional aspect. 

Tracking for its own sake does not violate the web architecture. However 
you run into trouble as soon as you take the next step and use the 
tracked path to determine which resource or representation you serve to 
the client, rather than having that depend purely on the URL and the 
relevant HTTP headers.

In practice I rarely see sites tracking users without also doing 
something obvious with those tracks.
